SENT.plain: OBJECTIVE: To report the prevalence of acute cerebrovascular accidents (ACVA) and risk factors for thrombosis among patients diagnosed of primary antiphospholipid syndrome (PAPLS) and to compare this group with that of patients with PAPLS but not ACVA
PATIENTS AND METHODS: Retrospective data analysis of 30 patients consecutively diagnosed of PAPLS
Episodes of ACVA were quantitated and other cardiovascular risk factors were determined
RESULTS: Thirty percent of patients (9/30) had one or more ACVA
No significant differences were found when the presence of other cardiovascular risk factors in both groups was compared
CONCLUSIONS: Antiphospholipid antibodies in young patients with ACVA should be determined, although some other cardiovascular risk factors may coexist
